title: Desperation, decision-making and funky formations: How England’s defence suffocated New Zealand
text:
In two matches against New Zealand as England defence coach, John Mitchell has constricted the All Blacks and restricted them to two tries and a meagre total of 23 points.

That must feel pretty satisfying for the Hawera-born 55 year-old, who has justified his appointment in spectacular style.

England reached the final of Rugby World Cup 2019 with a defensive performance that married tenacity and technique, with a few intelligent and unconventional plans thrown in for good measure.

1. Kick-chase and pressure on ‘exits’
